Package nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.api

Interface IGlowingBlockSpawner

All Known Implementing Classes:
GlowingBlockSpawner
public interface IGlowingBlockSpawner
Represents a glowing block used for highlights
Author:
Pim

  • Method Details

    • spawnGlowingBlock

      Optional<IGlowingBlock> spawnGlowingBlock(IPPlayer player, IPWorld world, int time, TimeUnit timeUnit, double x, double y, double z, PColor color)
      Spawns a glowing block.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will see the glowing block.
      world - The world in which the glowing block will be spawned
      time - How long the glowing block will be visible.
      timeUnit - The unit of the time. Note that one tick is 50ms, so that is the absolute lowest value possible! Any values less than that will mean nothing is spawned.
      x - The x-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      y - The y-coordinate of the glowing block.
      z - The z-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      color - The color of the outline.
      Returns:
      The IGlowingBlock that was spawned.

    • spawnGlowingBlock

      default Optional<IGlowingBlock> spawnGlowingBlock(IPPlayer player, IPWorld world, int time, double x, double y, double z, PColor color)
      Spawns a glowing block.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will see the glowing block.
      world - The world in which the glowing block will be spawned
      time - How long the glowing block will be visible (in seconds).
      x - The x-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      y - The y-coordinate of the glowing block.
      z - The z-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      color - The color of the outline.
      Returns:
      The IGlowingBlock that was spawned.

    • spawnGlowingBlock

      default Optional<IGlowingBlock> spawnGlowingBlock(IPPlayer player, IPWorld world, int time, TimeUnit timeUnit, double x, double y, double z)
      Spawns a glowing block.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will see the glowing block.
      world - The world in which the glowing block will be spawned
      time - How long the glowing block will be visible.
      timeUnit - The unit of the time. Note that one tick is 50ms, so that is the absolute lowest value possible! Any values less than that will mean nothing is spawned.
      x - The x-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      y - The y-coordinate of the glowing block.
      z - The z-coordinate of the glowing block. An offset of 0.5 is applied to make it align by default.
      Returns:
      The IGlowingBlock that was spawned.

    • spawnGlowingBlock

      default Optional<IGlowingBlock> spawnGlowingBlock(IPPlayer player, int time, TimeUnit timeUnit, IPLocation location)
      Spawns a glowing block.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who will see the glowing block.
      time - How long the glowing block will be visible (in seconds).
      timeUnit - The unit of the time. Note that one tick is 50ms, so that is the absolute lowest value possible! Any values less than that will mean nothing is spawned.
      location - The location where the glowing block will be spawned.
      Returns:
      The IGlowingBlock that was spawned.

    • spawnGlowingBlocks

      default List<IGlowingBlock> spawnGlowingBlocks(AbstractDoor abstractDoor, IPPlayer player)
      Spawns the glowing blocks required to highlight a door.
      Parameters:
      abstractDoor - The door to highlight.
      player - The IPPlayer for whom to highlight the door.
      Returns:
      The list of IGlowingBlocks that were spawned.
